This app collects GPS, accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer and peak audio data from the phone when the app is running and the user has requested logging be started. \n\nThe data collected is sent securely to our server for analysis and use in a research project.

Data collection 

The CradleRide logger app is a research tool for collecting sensor data from phones. The sensor data is not collected automatically. It will only start with direct user intervention.


The data collected depends on the features available on the phone being used, but can include: 
	Accelerometer data, sampled at the fastest rate 
	Gyroscope data, sampled at the fastest rate 
	GPS position data, sampled at approximately 1Hz 
	Audio data, sampled at 100-200Hz - the highest amplitude component within the sampling time window only


A unique identifier is used per phone, so that multiple uses of the same phone can be correlated and combined.


All data is saved on the phone locally, then after the user stops the logging session and the phone subsequently enters a WiFi zone, the saved data is uploaded to our servers only.


The data saved on our server will not be shared with any third party without further consultation with the users.


The data from multiple logging events from the same user will be combined to produce aggregate data about the environment in which the user is located, but not about the user themselves.


All data is transmitted securely.
Auto-stop shuts off the app when accidentally left logging. \n\nTurning off could lead to excess battery usage.
